Dieter pulls the card with an icon of a carinthosaur from dashboard of the jeep and marks a black X over the drawin the animal.

dialogues.speaker: DIETER
dialogues.text: Next case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night has fallen over the island. The hunters have established base camp in an area they have trampled and cleared just below the ridge. Blue laser fences encircle perimeter. Inside, half a dozen tents are set up around a central campfire. The vehicles are all parked at one end, away from the ten At the other end, there is a row of at least a dozen "cap containers," cages that hold the imprisoned dinosaurs the have already rounded up. SARAH, MALCOLM, and NICK stand at the edge of the ridge a looking down at the scene. Sarah stands a bit further bac from the others, not wanting to get too close to the edge VOICES waft up to them, raucous, LAUGHING, some even SIN DR. JUTTSON has a pair of night-vision binoculars trained the cages.

dialogues.speaker: JUTTSON
dialogues.text: Carinthosaurus -- compsognathus -- triceratops -- pachycephalosaurus -- or small scavengers only. Malcolm, also with binoculars, furrows his brow, seeing something below.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH MALCOLM'S BINOCULARS,
dialogues.text: he sees PETER LUDLOW, standing in the middle of the camp, pointing, giving orders.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE RIDGE,
dialogues.text: Malcolm drops the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Ludlow. That's why Hammond was in Such a hurry for me to get here. He knew they were coming. He gives the binoculars to Sarah, who moves forward ginge MALCOLM (cont'd) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (irritated) Heights, I can't help it. Put your arm here, will you? She puts his arm around her waits, to steady her while sh close to the cliff edge.

dialogues.speaker: JUTTSON
dialogues.text: What do they want?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: They want their money back. To InGen, this island is nothing more than a bed investment.

dialogues.speaker: JUTTSON
dialogues.text: We should get back to base camp. Eddie's waiting for us.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I can't believe Peter Ludlow's running all this.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He isn't. Check out the guy walking past the fire. She hands the binoculars to Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE BINOCULARS,
dialogues.text: Malcolm sees ROLAND, who's walking with AJAY, weapons and equipment slung over their shoulders. SARAH (0.s.) I've seen him before. In Brazil. He and that guy with him were spearhunting jaguars. Said it was immoral to go after them any other way. He's not just a hunter, he's a philosopher. Kind of guy who beats you up with your own argument.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE RIDGE,
dialogues.text: SARAH (cont'd) He's the one in charge.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Well, if that's true -- the man in charge just left camp. Nick, who has been quietly fuming next to them, now steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Then this is our chance.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Our chance to do what?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I don't know these guys, but I know ‘em. I've seen ‘em on Japanese whalers, French barges trying to dump barrels of nuclear waste in the North Atlantic. They're all the same. They spray us with water cannon when we try to stop 'em, sink our boats, and then call us crazy. He rummages through his pack, coming up with various tool hunting knife. A bolt cutter. NICK (cont'd) Nobody has to come with me. I've done this before.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Why, Nick. You are a tree-hugger.  He looks at her, hurt.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: There’ no reason for name calling.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Dr. Juttson, please take Kelly back to camp right away. Leave the other car for us and we'll meet you there in an hour or so.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: What are you guys gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (signs) Exactly what John Hammond wanted us to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the hunters’ supply tent, a case of twelve-year-old sc sits open amid crate after crate of weapons and ammunitio PETER LUDLOW reaches in and pulls a bottle out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the jungle, LUDLOW approaches a small clearing. ROLAND bent over a small stake in the ground, chaining something it. As Ludlow approaches and walks around him, he sees wh protest. Roland looks up.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Offering a little incentive. Ludlow laughs and shakes his head. He takes a drink and offers Roland one. Roland accepts. Ludlow notices Roland' gun leaning against a tree.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: What kind of gun is that?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: My father's .600 Nitro Express. Made in 1904. Karimojo Bell gave it to him after he took down his last elephant. 8700 foot pound striking force.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: How close do you have to be?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Forty yards. Less, maybe. I assume it'll take a slug in the brain case  to bring him down.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Why not just use a scope and a poison dart and snipe him from a hill? Roland just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Or a laser beam from a satellite? Ludlow leans down, close to the baby rex, and examines it while it thrashes on its chain. Its mouth has been bound with a leather strap.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: You rally think this'll draw the parent?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: I once saw a bull elephant die charging a jeep. All the jeep had done was startle the bull's calves. I saw a lioness carry wounded prey four and a half miles, all the way back to its den, just to teach its cubs how to finish off a kill.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Killing lessons? Heartwarming.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Rex won't be any different. It'll come.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: You're kidding yourself. An adult T-rex cares about one thing -- filling its own belly. It acts the way people wish they could, that's why everyone's fascinated by it. If people had the chance to see one dinosaur and one only, ninety-nine percent would -- He stops, an idea on his face. LUDLOW (cont'd) Wait. Why not? Sedatives. growth inhibitors...

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: I hadn't planned on bringing carnivores back because of the  liability risk, but I only thought of adults, it never occurred to me -- (close to the animal) You are a billion dollar idea, my little f£- CRACK! The tyrannosaur, even with its jaws clamped shut, lunges at Ludlow's face, head-butting him right across th bridge of the nose. Ludlow staggers back, WAITING in pain clutching his bleeding face. Roland laughs. Ludlow, like an enraged child, snatches up Roland's gun and brings the butt down viciously on the re leg. The bone breaks with a dry SNAP and the animal HOWLS pain. Roland lunges and throws Ludlow to the ground, but the da is done.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: What the hell you do that for?! As his pain eases, Ludlow feels a bit foolish, but he att to cover.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Had to. To keep him still for the trip.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: You've broken its leg!

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: We've got to transport it seven thousand miles. Would you prefer it bit off the leg of a crew member? He gets up, brushes himself off, and heads back to the ca trying to salvage his dignity. Roland watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the edge of the hunters' camp, NICK, SARAH, and MALCOL scramble down a hillside and stop at the edge of the lase barriers. There are three beams, each about two feet apar the tallest almost six feet off the ground. Nick reaches the edge and crouches. Sarah, helped by Malc steps up onto his back and jumps over the top, landing wi CRUNCH. Nick is next, given a boost by Malcolm, who is th left alone on the other side. He backs up a few steps, jogs right at the lasers, then springs off his good leg -- -- and does the Fosburry Flop right over the top. He lan with a THUD, to the silent admiration of the other two.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER IN THE CAMP,
dialogues.text: the three of them creep along, hiding behind a stack of f barrels. They lean around the edge for a look. They're directly behind the row of vehicle. They move, into the open, covering the ground between the the jeeps. Reaching them, Nick hits the dirt and wriggles under the first one. Malcolm and Sarah stand lookout.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE JEEP,
dialogues.text: Nick pulls the bolt cutter from his back pocket. He squir along until he finds the jeep's fuel line -- -- and he snips it. He ducks out of the way just as the stream of fuel begins to pour into the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM AND SARAH
dialogues.text: move slowly down the line, standing watch as Nick crawls from under the first jeep and proceeds to the second. The hear another SNIP, then keep moving, to cover him as he m to the third. From in the distance, Malcolm hears a sound, a faint, high-pitched SCREECHING. He turns and looks to that direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the baby T-rex, still SCREENING. Up in a nearby tree ROLAND and AJAY have spread some broken branches crosswis form a high hide of their own about ten feet off the grou They wait. Roland raises his binoculars. The light of the camp spill all the way out here, illuminating some of the jungle. He scans it, searching for any sign of movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the camp, Sarah, Malcolm, and Nick have finished all of the vehicles except the badly battered one, which parked some distance away, undergoing repairs. The motor area is now a soggy lake of spilled gasoline. The saboteurs walk casually across the camp, unnoticed in drunken revelry. They pass several tents, the shadows of partiers visible as they move inside. They continue across the camp and arrive at the other sid  -- to face the caged animals. The carinthosaur that was tranquilized earlier stands there dully, eyes heavy and glassy, still under the effects. They pass a stegosaur, i row of fine bristling. And finally they reach the largest cage, which houses a triceratops the size of a pickup truck, Nick pulls out hi trusty bolt cutters. He looks at them, a glint in his eye

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hang on. We may encounter some turbulence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one of the hunter tents, PETER LUDLOW leans over the satellite recon pictures of the island, planning the next day's assault with DIETER and DR. BURKE, their paleontolo There are small wooden dinosaur models scattered around t photos, indicating where certain species can be found.

dialogues.speaker: BURKE
dialogues.text: If you're really interested in infants, we'll have better luck at the seaside, because the sands offer a cushioning surface where the egg clutches can -- can -- He trails off. A low RUMBLING sound can be heard outside, the little wooden dinosaurs start shaking on the board. They look at each other. The RUMBLING gets louder. Outsid someone SHOUTS; on the board, the little dinosaurs start hopping and bouncing from the vibrations, the SHOUTS outs turn to SCREAMS, they turn and look at the back of the te -- and the triceratops bursts right through the canvas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUNTERS go flying as the tent-covered triceratops, its ho tearing through the canvas, RUMBLES across the camp. Men SHOUT in alarm, the triceratops BELLOWS in anger and confusion, chaos reigns. In the crush of PEOPLE running every which way, MALCOLM a SARAH are swept off in one direction while NICK is buffet in another. They SHOUT, but cannot be heard over the frey The triceratops, blinded by the canvas shroud, stomps rig through the fire in the middle of the camp AND THE TENT B INTO FLAME. Now really upset, the animal panics and lashes out in all directions, blasting through tents, demolishing and/or se ablaze anything that gets in its way. Its considerable hindquarters SLAM into a parked jeep, sending it rolling  across the camp. The jeep flattens the largest tent and SLAMS down on its Its broken gas line SPRAYS gas over the ground, the gas h one of the dozens of small blazes the triceratops has lef its wake, and the flame shoots up the ribbon of gas. The jeep explodes.

dialogues.speaker: OUT IN THE JUNGLE CLEARING,
dialogues.text: Roland and Ajay, up in the tree, leap to their feet as a fireball rises up from the camp in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: What in God's -- !

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE CAMP,
dialogues.text: the rest of the newly-freed animals now storm through the camp. The blue laser barriers bounce crazily and go out a the sending units are trampled underfoot by the fleeing animals.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE RIDGE OF CAMP,
dialogues.text: Nick takes advantage of the downed lasers to slip part th bordere of the camp and disappear into the jungle in one direction, while Malcolm and Sarah vanish in the other. The burning tent, which was the equipment tent, now deton in a series of smaller EXPLOSIONS. Dieter and several others are knocked to the ground by th series of concessive blasts. He drags himself up onto all fours, charred and bruised. A burning tire rolls slowly p him, spinning to a stop -- -- at ROLAND's feet. Dieter looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Last time I leave you in charge.

dialogues.speaker: OUT IN THE JUNGLE,
dialogues.text: Nick breaks out into the jungle clearing, the same one wh Ajay and Roland had their blind. He sees the baby tyranno chained to the stake.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Sick bastards. He goes to the animal, which now BLEATS in pain, its brok leg hanging at an odd angle. With one strong tug, Nick pu the stake out of the ground.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE CAMP,
dialogues.text: Roland surveys the destruction. The fire has spread and several tents are now tongues of flame flapping in the ai the animals are gone or going, and their personnel are scattered and terrified. PETER LUDLOW, breathless, face smeared with dirt, and smoke, staggers up to Roland.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: What in Christ's name is going on?!

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Isn't it obvious? He holds up the sniped padlock from one of the animal cag NICK (cont'd) We're not alone on this island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALCOLM and SARAH race back up onto the ridge trail, wher green AAV is parked. NICK bursts around from the other si of the car.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Nick, thank God, we didn't know if -- Malcolm opens the rear door.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Wait, don't --- With a piercing SHRIEK, the BABY TYRANNOSAUR, now in the of the AAV, flings itself at the open doorway, jaws SNAPP just short of Malcolm's nose.

dialogues.speaker: HOLY SHIT
dialogues.text: He SLAMS the door.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN IN THE HUNTERS' CAMP,
dialogues.text: Roland hears the commotion up on the ridge and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Do we have anyone up there?

dialogues.speaker: BACK UP ON THE RIDGE,
dialogues.text: Malcolm is confronting Nick.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: <U< your of out you>?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has a broken leg!

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: So do it a favor and put it out of its misery!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No! Get in the car before they hear us! He runs around and leaps in the driver's seat. Sarah slip into the passenger seat, quickly, leaving Malcolm no choi but the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AAV SLAPS through the jungle foliage. From inside the car, we can hear the baby tyrannosaur SCREAMING in anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby writhes on the base seat next to Malcolm, who ha flattened himself against the door, as far away from the animal as possible.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ian, close the window, it's going to wake every predator in the jungle! Malcolm leans over the enraged animal and cranks up its window. The tyrannosaur SLASHES with one of its powerful legs, ripping the flesh of his forearm. He SHOUTS in pain Outside, the listening jungle whizzes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up in the high hide, EDDIE, DR. JUTTSON, and KELLY are standing watch, scanning the jungle for any sign of their returning comrades. Juttson yanks the night-vision binoculars away from his f as he spots the AAV, pulling up to the base camp a couple hundred yards away.

dialogues.speaker: JUTTSON
dialogues.text: There they are! They all turn and look, but Eddie furrows his brow, watch them pull the wounded animal from the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: What is that they have with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH and NICK carry the SCREECHING baby tyrannosaur in t arms, headed for the trailer. MALCOLM, holding his bleedi arm, isn't far behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH and NICK bring the SCREAMING infant to the metal di table and hold it down. MALCOLM is right behind them.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: This is exceedingly unwise. Sarah turns away from a drawer of medical supplies, holdi small syringe. Her shirt is streaked with blood from the baby's injured leg.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Too late to worry about that! Hold him together, Nick! Nick tightens his grip on the animal and Sarah makes an injection into its thigh, over its loudly voiced objectio

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Just do whatever you have to do and get it out of here as quickly as possible. Sarah picks up a small ultrasound transducer and runs it the animal's leg. A green and white skeletal image appear a monitor next to the table.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Okay, there's the metatarsals -- tibia, fibula -- there it is! See it? That's a fracture, just above the epiphysis. They peer closely at the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: That little black line?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That little black line means death for this infant. The fibula won't heal straight, so the ankle joint can't pivot when he stands on his hind feet. The baby won't be able to run, and probably can't even walk. It'll be crippled, and a predator will pick it off before it gets more than a few weeks old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you set up?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (thinking) It has to be temporary, something that'll break apart and fall off as the animal grows...

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Think fast, Sarah. The tyrannosaur, still in pain, SHRIEKS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through their binoculars, the rest of the group watches t trailer carefully. Even inside, the animal's SCREECHES ar clearly audible. Kelly is getting scared.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: What are they doing? Why don't they hurry?!

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Give me the radio. From the trailer, the baby lets out a long, plaintive

dialogues.speaker: SHRIEK --
dialogues.text: One by one, Eddie, Kelly, and Juttson turn around and sta into the night jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK holds the animal while SARAH fits an aluminum foil c around its injured leg and paints it with a coating of re MALCOLM, at the window, stares out anxiously. The animal thrashes again.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Give it more morphine!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We'll kill it with too much, we'll put it into respiratory arrest! I'm almost done. Damn it, I need another adhesive, something pliable I can --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes fall on Nick. She holds out her hand, urgently. SARAH (cont'd) spit! He spits his bubblegum into the palm of her hand. The bab rex CRIES OUT again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the swaying jungle, there is another answering ROAR. And this one's closer. In the high hide, the rest of the group stares, trembling the distance, a flock of birds SHRIEKS and takes flight a tops of some trees move, a whole section of forest sudden coming alive, as if brushed by wind. But it's not the wind. They hear noises, THUDS in the jungle. And then another section of forest trembles. Closer. Another flock of bird bursts out of the treetops and swarms past the high hide.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: What is it? Dr. Juttson puts an arm around Kelly, instinctively pulli her closer to him. Eddie WHISPERS urgently into the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Sarah, come in!

dialogues.speaker: JUTTSON
dialogues.text: It's moving. Fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a radio box mounted on the far wall of the trail The speaker BUZZES urgently with Eddie's VOICE. EDDIE (o.s.) Sarah, Malcolm, can you hear me?! On the table, Sarah is frantically molding Nick's bubbleg into place on the makeshift splint. But the baby rex, regaining its strength, is thrashing again.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hold it down, Nick!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I'm trying! EDDIE (o.s.) (from the radio) Is anybody there?! Malcolm moves to answer the radio, but Sarah SHOUTS to hi

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ian, get the bottle of amoxicillin  and fill a syringe! Quick injection of antibiotics and I can get it out of here! Forsaking the radio, Malcolm moves to the medicine drawer comes up with what she wants. Working fast, he draws twen cc's of the pink liquid. EDDIE (o.s.) (still from the radio, now desperate)

dialogues.speaker: SARAH OR IAN, ANSWER ME
dialogues.text: They ignore him as Sarah grabs the syringe and makes the injection. EDDIE (0.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie has given up on whispering as he clutches the radio desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Sarah, and Malcolm spin around at hearing that terr piece of information.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ. He bolts over to the wall speaker and hits the button. MALCOLM (cont'd) Let me talk to Kelly, is she-- A deafening ROAR sound from just outside the trailer, followed immediately by a CRASHING sound. They whirl and to the window, just in time to see -- -- _the AAV tumbling by, rolling on its side!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is another ROAR, and the baby, on the table, ROARS response. Outside the window, the head of a full-grown TYRANNOSAURUS REX lowers and peers inside. Malcolm, Sarah, and Nick all freeze in absolute terror. The rex outside GURGLES, making material cooing noises. T baby rex, calm for the first time, GURGLES back. But across the trailer, in the opposite window, ANOTHER HEAD SUDDENLY APPEARS. This one ROARS, deeply, a roar so low and loud it rattles anything in the trailer that isn't tied down.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What do they want?!

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: What do you think they want?!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That's impossible, they can't have the sensory equipment to track it all the way here!

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Current evidence seems to be to the contrary, wouldn't you say?! GIVE IT

dialogues.speaker: TO THEM
dialogues.text: Nick, hands shaking, grabs the shoulder video camera he u earlier. He whips out the cassette that's in there, hurls into an open duffel bag with half a dozen others, SLAMS a fresh cassette in, and flicks the "ON" switch. Sarah and Malcolm, meanwhile, hurry to the other end of t trailer, carrying the baby rex. Outside, the two adult re stay with them, walking in the same direction, watching t through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen from outside, the light inside the trailers clearly illuminates Sarah and Malcolm as they carry the bay rex. adult rexes tower over the trailer, twice as tall and nea as long. They walk slowly alongside it, hunched over, watching their infant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the door to the trailer, Sarah un-muzzles the frantic

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ready? Malcolm reaches for the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Wait! He dives down on the floor under them, pointing the video camera up at the door, getting the best shot. Malcolm tak breath, turns the knob, and throws open the door. Outside, the enormous rex heads pause for a moment, stari  surprised. Although terrified, Sarah actually starts to sing.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (softly) Born free, as free as the wind blows. As free as the grass grows --

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Are you insane?!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I swear to God, it works with lions sometimes! There we are -- your baby is free -- The baby, excited, wriggles free of them and lands on the ground outside. Not wasting a second, Malcolm SLAMS the d shut. The three of them freeze, not daring to breath. Outside, can hear the SNUFFLING and COOING of the animals as they inspect their young -- -- and then the soft THUD of their footsteps, growing fai as they move away. From the wall, EDDIE'S VOICE comes over the radio, reliev

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: They're going back into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE, JUTTSON, and KELLY sag back against the railings o high hide.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Thank God. Thank God. MALCOLM'S VOICE comes over the radio. MALCOLM (0.s.) Kelly? Are you all right? She takes the radio, her voice shaky.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALCOLM is at the radio.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Wait there. I'll come up ina minute. Don't move, understand? KELLY (0.s.) I understand. Malcolm slump against the wall of the trailer. SARAH and NICK sit on the floor leaning against the opposite wall, completely drained. Sarah pulls out her pocket recorder a speaks shakily into it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Note to Dr. Juttson -- Tyrannosaurus rex does nurture its young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh weakly.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: There's, uh -- there's an unwritten rule when a news crew is in a war zone. You stop the van every two miles and decide whether or not to go on. Whether or not you feel lucky. One "no" from anybody in the group and you turn around right there, no question asked, nobody embarrassed. (pause) Well? Do we go on? Immediately:

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: No

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No way. They all laugh.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: All right. I'm satisfied with the evidence we have right now. I feel vindicated. John Hammond will too. (to Sarah) Do you have enough to publish?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: They will come after me. But I can collect some stool samples, for DNA with that, Nick's tapes, and the rest of you to back me up, it should stand  when we get back.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (getting up) Then the only thing left to do is make sure we do get back. I'll call the mainland on the satellite phone and have them send the boat right now. This expedition is over. He goes to the desk and picks up the heavy gray satellite phone that's resting in a battery pack. The front panel lights up, a brilliant green. But from the wall speaker, the radio CRACKLES and EDDIE'S VOICE breaks through, soft and empty. EDDIE (0.s.) Oh, God. I am so sorry. Malcolm and Sarah look at the speaker box.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: What the hell is he sorry f- A low RATTLE sneaks into the trailer. Malcolm, Sarah, and Nick takes a step forward from the walls, looking around. RATTLE gets louder, the trailer shakes and vibrates, everything in it starts to BANG against the walls -- -- and something huge SMASHES into the side of the traile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all thrown against the far wall, there is an earsplitting CRACK of electricity, the entire trailer roc and sparks a brilliant blue, and then everything goes bla The satellite phone flies out of Malcolm's hands and SMAC against the wall. It lands on the floor, its number pad s glowing green. Nick crawls over and looks out one of the windows. Outsid the flank of one of the tyrannosaurs wipes past the windo revealing the second tyrannosaur, charging straight at th trailer!

dialogues.speaker: HANG ON TO SOMETHING
dialogues.text: They hurl themselves at the nearest solid object and hang for dear life. The charging rex SLAM into the side of the trailer, which rocks up on one side, BANGS back down, and quickly RAMMED again by the furious animal. This time the entire trailer rolls over, completely upside down. Sarah, Nick, and Malcolm let go of their precarious handh and drop onto the ceiling. The tables, chairs, lab equipm everything that's bolted down clings to the floor above t  everything that isn't RAINS DOWN ON THEM. But the rexes aren't done. The trailer JOLTS INTO MOTION, sliding forwards.

dialogues.speaker: SEEN FROM OUTSIDE,
dialogues.text: the upside down trailer, which is the rear of the two trailers, slides along the muddy ground, pushing up earth front of it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: They're pushing us! Malcolm, frantic, crawls up to a window to get a look out He looks down and sees a T-rex footprint in the earth out as they move past it. He cranks his head to get a look at the direction in whic they are being pushed. His eyes widen at something he see outside the window.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: They're pushing us over the cliff. Sure enough, out the back window, we see a few more feet muddy earth, and then nothing but inky black. The three o them look at each other for a moment -- -- and then crawl like hell toward the other end of the trailer. The opposite end reaches the edge of the cliff a starts up to tip ever-so-slightly downward. They reach th accordion-like connector and Malcolm crawls into it.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD OF THE FRONT TRAILER,
dialogues.text: which is right-side-up, Malcolm can see the two rexes har it, pushing the front end of the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE REAR TRAILER,
dialogues.text: Nick has a pretty good grip at the top of the trailer, bu Sarah can only cling to an air vent in the ceiling as stu starts to roll and tumble past her, headed downhill. The angle increases, the trailer dips, and now stuff star freefall, right past her, some SMASHING her in the head. Malcolm, still in the connecting tube, grabs hold. Sarah, starting to be pulled downward, paws at the refrigerator getting a g rip on the handle. The door, held by a safety latch, doesn't open. Below Sarah, debris falls to the rear window of the trail Through the CRACKING glass, we can see the surf, CRASHING hundred feet below. The refrigerator bolts suddenly CRUNCH free of the wall. box strains on its power cord. Still clinging to the handle, Sarah swings wildly as it s to come loose, swaying above her. The safety latch on the door gives, it swings open, and a shower of food BANGS off of her as gravity empties the contents. Sarah loses her grip and plummets through the now-vertica trailer. She SCREAMS, covers her head, and SMASHES into t rear window. The glass spiderwebs, but does not break.

dialogues.speaker: FIVE HUNDRED FEET BELOW,
dialogues.text: an enormous wave POUNDS the rocky shore. Above, Sarah is tiny figure, sprawled out on the glass, held invisibly by breaking window.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TRAILER,
dialogues.text: Nick SHOUTS to her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Sarah, stunned by the fall, blinks a few times, regaining senses. She looks down, at the crashing surf so far below For a person with a fear of heights, this is a real drag. she stares, the rocks seem to move even farther away from She blanches; the world spins around her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: OH... GOD ... please... Her breath fogs the cracked glass. Slowly, she tries to g up, caaaaaarefully pulling herself up to her hands and kn But as she puts pressures on her hands, the glass CRACKS more, tiny spiderwebs shooting out around her fingers. Th whole glass panel sags, bowing out around the bottom of t trailer.

dialogues.speaker: UP ABOVE HER,
dialogues.text: Malcolm looks down and sees the satellite phone precariou balanced on one leg of the kitchen table, its number pad glowing green. Nick is closest to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick! Grab the phone!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: looks to her right, at a metal grating that runs along th wall of the trailer. She shifts her weight, leaning on on hand to reach for the grating with the other.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: reaches for the satellite phone, its antenna just six inc from his outstretched fingers.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: leans toward the metal grating, all hairline cracks shoot around her pivot hand, shaking through the glass. The splintered glass spread like a disease, it reaches the ed of the frame -- -- and her hand CRACKS right through the glass. She GASPS pulls her hand out, but now she knees SMASH through the glass.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: has two fingers on the phone, but suddenly the whole trai shudders and the heavy phone tips off the table leg and f

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: lunges for the metal grating and clings to it just as the heavy phone whizzes past her head and SMASHES into the gl opening up a huge hole in the center of the back window.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERNEATH THE TRAILER,
dialogues.text: glass, food, lab equipment, and the precious satellite ph fall out the broken window and SMASH on the rocks far bel

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CLEANING,
dialogues.text: the trailers are split, like an L, the rear trailer hangi straight down, the forward one resting on the edge of the cliff. Satisfied with their work, the T-rexes turn and lu back into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TRAILER,
dialogues.text: Sarah climbs carefully up the metal grating. Above her, N lowers himself as far as he can, reaching for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we realize the hanging trailer halted its descent because corner of it is wedged in the branches of a tree that gro out from the muddy cliff. But now those branches SPLINTER.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TRAILER,
dialogues.text: Malcolm sees the bellows, the connector between the trail stretch as the lower trailer JERKS and dips lower.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW HIM,
dialogues.text: Sarah mountain-climbs through the trailer's kitchen, inadvertently kicking the faucet on as she struggles for purchase.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE,
dialogues.text: the tree branch SNAPS and the trailer jerks, stretching d again. The bellows expands to its full length, stretching like a Slinky.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE,
dialogues.text: Nick knows he has to hurry. He climbs down, bouncing off built-in furniture, moving ever closer to Sarah. But Sarah slips and loses her grip, dropping a few feet. gabs hold of the sink, the flowing water spraying her fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE CARR is in the driver's seat of the jeep, racing th the jungle as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Hang on -- hang on -- The foliage SMACKS the windshield, then clears suddenly, revealing the endangered trailers on the cliffside ahead him. The jeep bounces through the deep footprints left by rex and SKIDS to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah loses her grip on the sink and falls, SMASHING into frame of the half-broken rear window again.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE,
dialogues.text: Eddie bolts out of the car and runs to the front trailer. SHOUTS in through the broken front window.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE REAR TRAILER,
dialogues.text: The three look up from their precarious positions.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE,
dialogues.text: Eddie turns and run back to the jeep. He grabs a coil of rope, secures one end around a tree, and hurries back to trailer.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE REAR TRAILER,
dialogues.text: Eddie dashes over the mess in the front trailer and crawl into the extended connector. He peers over the edge, down into the second trailer, and tosses the rope.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Catch! The rope falls through the center of the trailer, its end dangling all the way out the smashed rear window. But the trailer SHUDDERS, starting to move again.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We're sliding!

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Climbs up if you can!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE,
dialogues.text: Eddie runs out of the trailer in time to see the wheels dragging forward through the mud as the weight of the dan trailer pulls the whole thing toward the edge of the clif He runs for the jeep and grabs hold of the power winch on front grill. Behind him, the trailer rolls closer to the edge of the c Eddie races back to the trailer, pulling out a length of behind him. He runs up to the still-moving trailer, dives its towing hook, the cable goes taut -- -- and he falls short. Just by six inches, but he's out o cable.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TRAILER,
dialogues.text: Nick and Sarah are now together, clinging to the rope ne bottom of the trailer as it shifts around them. Malcolm i further up, also clinging to the rope.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE,
dialogues.text: dirt and rocks pile up around the wheels and spill over t edge of the cliff. Eddie, back at the jeep, reels out more winch cable. He t and races back to the trailer just as gravity starts to L

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT END OFF THE GROUND
dialogues.text: Eddie dives again, and this time the cable hook CLICKS securely into the trailer's towing hook. The trailer lurc toward the edge of the cliff and stops. But the jeep is jerked forward by the sudden pressure.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TRAILER,
dialogues.text: Malcolm clings to the rope in the middle of the trailer w Nick and Sarah try to struggle up it, but a sudden dig kn them back, and their hands slide down the line. SCREAMING they slide through the trailer and their feet SMASH throu the remains of the rear window. Regaining hold of the rope at the very end, the two of th now find themselves hanging out of the rear end of the tr dangling over the rocky shore below.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE JEEP,
dialogues.text: Eddie hits the gas and the tires slosh in the mud, trying get a grip. The jeep pulls just enough to lower the front trailer back to earth. But the tires spin, fighting to ho it there.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CLIFFSIDE
dialogues.text: Sarah and Nick dangle, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE JEEP
dialogues.text: Eddie CHUNKS the shifter into four wheel drive and GUNS t engine. As the motor ROARS, the sound is topped by anothe ROAR, in the distance. And this one's not a machine. But Eddie doesn't hear it. GUNS the engine again. There is another ROAR from the jun Eddie hears this one. He darts a look at the side view mirror. In it, he sees one of the TYRANNOSAURS bolt out o the jungle behind him. He GASPS and looks at the other side view. In it, he sees OTHER REX racing toward him. The tyrannosaurs STOMP forward to confront the ROARING j The first rex bends over, CHOMPS down on the rear tire, a lifts the car to its teeth. But the spinning tire LINGS in the rex's mouth, burning i Surprised by the fight in this foe, the rex loses its gri the jeep BANGS back down onto the ground. Eddie, horrified, dives down under the steering wheel, to away. The gas pedal pops up -- -- which makes the trailer pitch over the side of the cli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the rex STOMPS down on the jeep to prevent its escape The trailers stop. Now the rexes lean down, over the jeep, and focus on Eddi who still covers under the steering wheel. The first rex SNAPS at him, hitting the steering column with it, leavin exposed. He SCREAMS and the second rex lashes in, seizing him in i teeth and tossing him out of the car. Eddie pops up into the air between the two rexes, both th heads flash at him at the same time, and in a split-secon disappears between their teeth. Now completely ignored, the jeep rolls freely forward and trailers drop over the edge of the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TRAILER,
dialogues.text: Nick, Sarah and Malcolm cling to each other and the rope the trailers fall around them. The windows flash by as th trailers plummet, equipment BANGS and SCRAPES them, but t hold on to the rope, still tied to the tree, for dear lif

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CLIFFSIDE,
dialogues.text: the trailers slide the rest of the way, exposing the thre who pop out the space where the front windshield was. Dangling from the rope, they look up and see the jeep, wh is now rolling to the edge of the cliff. It falls, past them, and the whole mess EXPLODES on the r below. Finally, it is silent, except for the sound of the surf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet up here too, the rexes nowhere to be seen. At cliff, a hand appears from over the edge. Then another. SARAH pulls herself up, back onto solid ground, then come NICK, then both of them reach over and help MALCOLM up ov the edge.  They collapse there, in the mud, completely exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (softly) Eddie? He looks at the other two. They glance around, then drop their heads. Sarah hears a SOUND in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh, God. Now what? From the edge of the jungle, a cris-cross of flashlight b moves toward them. But rather than the three or four that would signify their own group, there are nearly twenty of them. The HUNTERS, PETER LUDLOW is in the lead, ROLAND and AJAY with him. DIETER is there too, shepherding KELLY and DR. JUTTSON along in front of him. Malcolm sees Kelly, they call out to each other, and race together. Malcolm falls to his knees and hugs her as tigh as he possibly can.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Are you all right?! Anything broken?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I'm fine, I'm fine, I was scared, I thought you, are you okay?!

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I'm fine... I'm fine... Roland looks around, at the mess that was their base camp

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: (mostly to himself) That's what you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the ruins of the first team's base camp, the survivors the night's two separate catastrophes stand face to face, heated argument. MALCOLM sits off to the side, still holding Kelly in his just looking down at the ground and shaking his head. The something about his posture of defeat that is far more om than any of the hot tempers that are flaring. LUDLOW rant SARAH while DIETER looms menacingly over NICK.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Trespassing, sabotage -- you could go to jail just for being here, did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Don't start a legal argument with me, this island isn't your property, and neither are these animals! DR. JUTTSON has encountered DR. BURKE.

dialogues.speaker: JUTTSON
dialogues.text: What are you doing here, Burke? There's no TV cameras, what's the point?

dialogues.speaker: BURKE
dialogues.text: Dr. Juttson, you exist outside the classroom. I am amazed. Dieter continues to get in Nick's face.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Are you looking for a problem?

dialogues.speaker: JUTTSON
dialogues.text: (an urgent whisper) Everyone, keep your voices down!

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Back off, Dieter.

dialogues.speaker: JUTTSON
dialogues.text: Listen to me, by moving the baby rex into our camp, we changed the adults' perceived territory!

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Their what?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (she understands) Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: JUTTSON
dialogues.text: That's why they persisted in destroying the trailers, they now feel they have to defend this entire area! We're not safe here.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: (of Sarah and Nick) Thanks to you people.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey, we came here to observe, you came here to strip-mine the place!  It's a looter mentality, all you care about is what you can take.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: None of that matters. Our communications equipment's been destroyed. If your radio and satellite phone were in those trailers that went off the cliff, and I'm guessing by the look on his face -- — He points at Malcolm, who is still off to the side, sitti stunned silence. Malcolm looks up and nods, slowly. The grimness of their situation sinks in. ROLAND (cont'd) We are stuck here, ladies and gentlemen. And we're stuck together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the hunters' now-demolished camp, members of the groups combine their diminished supplies. They have half dozen large plastic containers of water, thirty-seven containers of food, ranging from Ziploc bags to aluminum a variety of weapons, mot of them borne on the hips or shoulders of the HUNTER team, the charred and scraggly remnants of several pieces of now-useless electrical equipment, a flare gun and several flares, somebody's tat paperback ("Crime and Punishment"), a box of Hershey bars a cartoon of Marlboros. ROLAND supervises the assembling of the resources, which displayed in front of him. LUDLOW, NICK, SARAH, JUTTSON, MALCOLM, who is still holding KELLY close to him, are wit him. They hold their discussion in quiet tones.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: If we can't stay in the rex's territory, we have to move tonight.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Move where? Our boat's not coming for two days, your airlift is waiting for an order you have no way to send -- Ludlow refers to the charred and trampled satellite photographs of the island, which are still mostly legible

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: There's a communication center, here, in the old worker village. Hammond put in some kind of renewable power  source replenishing. It may still work. If we could get there, we could send a radio call for the airlift.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: How far is the village?

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: I said if we could get there.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Well, how far is it?

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: A day's walk, maybe more. That's not the problem.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: What is?

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: The velociraptors. Malcolm looks up sharply. LUDLOW (cont'd) Our infrareds show their nesting sites are concentrated in the island interior. That's why we planned on keeping to the outer rim. Malcolm shepherds Kelly away from the conversation and mu something to her quietly in the background.

dialogues.speaker: DIETER
dialogues.text: What are velociraptors?

dialogues.speaker: JUTTSON
dialogues.text: Carnivores. Pack hunters. About six feet long, three or four hundred pounds, and very, very fast. Dieter brandishes his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: DIETER
dialogues.text: I think we can handle ourselves against them. Malcolm rejoins the conversation, alone. He keeps his voi low.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: No. I'm quite certain you can't.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Look, we have two choices. We can  hike back down to the lagoon, where we can sit for two days, in the open, next to a heavily used water source while we're waiting for your boat to arrive, or we can head for the village, where we might find some shelter and we can call for help.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: We'd never make it past the raptors. Trust me, I have some experience in this matter. Roland looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: That may be. But you weren't with me at the time. Malcolm just shakes his head, then turns and walks back t Kelly. Roland turns to the others. ROLAND (cont'd) Load up. Let's get this moveable feast underway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SURVIVORS set forth, marching through the jungle in a column. Two HUNTERS strap on small shoulder-mounted servo-flashlights. Wires run from the lights end in sensor pads which they stick to the skin of their necks. attached, when the hunters turn their heads, the servo-li turn with them, illuminating whatever direction they look MALCOLM screws the barrel into the Lindstradt rifle and s it over his shoulder as he marches, limping heavily. He l down at KELLY, who is marching alongside him. His face sh the deepest of regret. He shakes his head, cursing himsel

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Damn it. He looks away as Kelly looks up at him, questioning. ROLA falls into step with Malcolm and notices his limp.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: You all right? Malcolm looks at him, then looks away without answering. ROLAND (cont'd) Wrong question?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You ever heard of Gambler's Ruin?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: A statistical phenomenon. Says everything in the world goes in streaks. It's real, you see it everywhere -- in weather, in river flooding, in baseball, in blackjack, in stock markets. Once things go bad, they tend to stay bad. Bad things cluster. They go to hell together.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Feeling a bit blue, are we? Malcolm glances at Kelly, who has taken a slightly faster and is a few steps ahead of them now.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Just -- flawed. Very deeply flawed.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Why did you come here?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: So that others would know about this place?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Why should they?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Because it exists.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: It'll still exit if they go on not knowing, won't it?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Yes. And people will live in the absence of truth.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: So the truth is more important to you than your life?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (lowers is voice) I don't care about my life. But if I'd ever thought for a second that she would be in danger --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roland follows his gaze forward, to Kelly, who's about te  yards ahead now.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: She yours?

dialogues.speaker: AHEAD OF THEM,
dialogues.text: Kelly can hear their voices, faint, but clear. They are n as far away as they think they are. MALCOLM (0.s.) I'm afraid so. I don't know what the hell I'm doing with kids. I never should have had her. Kelly's face shows she heard that part.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HER,
dialogues.text: Malcolm, unaware, continues with Roland. MALCOLM (cont'd) Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Somewhere on this island, there exits the greatest predator that ever lived. And the second greatest predator must take him down.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: But why?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: You remember that guy, about twenty years ago, I forget his name, but he climbed Everest without any oxygen, came down almost dead. And they asked him, "why did you go up there to die?" And he said "I didn't. I went up there to live."

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (nods) It's called self-testing. But in your case, it sounds more like self-destruction. A uniquely human characteristic. In fact, human beings destroy things so well that I sometimes think that's our function. Maybe every few sons, some animal comes along that kills off the rest of the world, clears the decks, and lets evolution proceed to his next phase. Maybe death and destruction are our job, maybe we're supposed to destroy ourselves and every other  living thing that- Every person on the trail within earshot has stopped and staring at Malcolm, shaken by his words. Roland grabs Mal by the shirt collar and pulls him close, GROWLING in his

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Tell you what. You can see whatever you want to, to me, but you will not spew any more nihilist rants at anyone else in the group. I'm fighting panic, and you push the wrong buttons. Understand? Malcolm just blinks. This guy's in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a purple dawn dissolves the night sky, the SURVIVORS stagger on, exhausted. Some are starting to tire, and the are spaces in the column. MALCOLM's limp seems to be gett worse. NICK reaches out, to take Malcolm's pack, but Malc swats his hand away. KELLY, still ahead of him, falls into step with SARAH.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I don't think -- my dad doesn't think we're going to make it. Sarah looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Your dad is wrong. About a lot more than he knows. She puts an arm around her. Kelly looks up at her, gratef The long march continues.

dialogues.speaker: UP AT THE FRONT,
dialogues.text: NICK catches up to ROLAND.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I think you should call a break.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Another half hour.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Some of them won't make another half hour. We didn't come this far to start dropping in the middle of the jungle. I£ you don't call it, I will.  Roland looks at him, steely, then SHOUTS to the group.

dialogues.speaker: FIVE MINUTES BREAK
dialogues.text: Immediately, the marchers drop where they stood, absolute drained.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE REAR OF THE GROUP,
dialogues.text: DRS. BURKE and JUTTSON are bickering.

dialogues.speaker: JUTTSON
dialogues.text: I can't believe you're still angry about that.

dialogues.speaker: BURKE
dialogues.text: You know, it's very easy to criticize the first person who studies something.

dialogues.speaker: JUTTSON
dialogues.text: No, it's easy to criticize sloppy research and hasty conclusions.

dialogues.speaker: NEARBY,
dialogues.text: MALCOLM checks Nick's bag of videotapes, making sure they still dry and undamaged. Sarah comes up, watching him.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You know, even if we do get those tapes back, people are going to say it's just another hoax. Ian Malcolm's alien autopsy.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Maybe. Maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ian, they will misplace our evidence, shoot holes in our testimony, and say some special effects genius created the animals. The only way people will ever believe that dinosaurs exist is if you dump a T-rex in the middle of times Square. He doesn't look at her. She sits down beside her. SARAH (cont'd) There's something more important that you should be thinking about instead.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THEM,
dialogues.text: Dr. Burke, furious, has stalked away from Juttson and si down on a rock. H does a double take, noticing something behind the rock. He leans over and picks it up. It's an oval shape about eight inches long, with a pebble exterior. A dinosaur egg. Burke's face lights up, fascinated, and he carefully piec the egg in a satchel he wears over one shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE REAR OF THE GROUP,
dialogues.text: DIETER STARK pulls a wad of toilet paper from his pack, d the pack on the ground, and turns to the Hunter nearest h CARTER, his driver, who has his back turned.

dialogues.speaker: DIETER
dialogues.text: Wait here for me, would ya Carter? He steps off the path, into the jungle. But as we come ar the front of Carter, we see he's wearing a Walkman, the headphone BLARING tinnily in his ears. And he didn't hear a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a few feet off the path, it's primary forest, the gr so thick that almost all sunlight is obscured. DIETER cla forward until he finds a suitable spot to relieve himself He clears away a bunch of leaves and debris and raises hi hand to his belt buckle. He freezes, hearing something we didn't. He glances around, head darting, alert to any dan Nothing there. Just a few distant ANIMAL CALLS-- -- and s SCURRYING around to his left. Dieter snaps his head in that direction. At first, he see nothing, but as he moves closer, gun extended in front of he sees a small dinosaur, a COMPSOGRATHUS, the same chicken-sized animal Cathy saw on the beach so long ago.

dialogues.speaker: DIETER
dialogues.text: It's not polite to -- He pulls the steel rod out of a loop in his belt and touc it to the compy's back. The blue bolt of electricity CRAC and dances over the compy's body and it convulses in pain DIETER (cont'd) -- sneak up on people. The wounded compsognathus scurries back into the jungle, whimpering. Dieter clambers through the foliage ten or tw paces, pushes aside two large palm fronds, and steps out  into -- -- more jungle. He stops, puzzled, not sure if he went ba or forward. He looks behind him. He pauses, recalculating the path he took coming into the jungle, MUTTERING to himself, gestur with his hands, retracing his steps. He adjusts his angle slightly to the right and heads off that direction. But after five or six hard-fought steps, stops again. Still nothing but jungle.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TRAIL,
dialogues.text: Dieter's cries are faint, but audible. The only Marchers enough to hear him is CARTER, but the Walkman is blaring his ears. DIETER (o.s.) ...Carter... me?...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE JUNGLE,
dialogues.text: Dieter hears that SCURRYING sound again, this time from h right. He adjusts his angle again and SCRAPES through the foliage, moving faster and faster. Panicking, he ties to run, but the roots rise high out of ground in the jungle, and he trips on one and falls flat his face. He looks up. The SCURRYING sound comes again, this time t times louder than before, like a hundred feet coming at h Dieter GASPS as something rushes in at him. He whirls to his right. Whatever it is rushes in from tha side as well. And the left. And behind him. Dieter scrambles up into a sitting position -- -- and laughs. He is surrounded by at least forty compys the same as the one he wounded. For a long moment, they just stare at him. Slowly, he bri his gun around, to point it at them.

dialogues.speaker: DIETER
dialogues.text: Easy -- wait -- one more sec- As one, the compys SHRIEK and hurl themselves forward, covering Dieter's body. Their teeth and claws FLASH as th each try to grab a scrap of his flesh, tearing savagely. Dieter SCREAMS and flails, waving his arms and legs wild Some of the tiny animals lose their grip and sail off, SMASHING into trees or the ground. But dozens of others h on, and Dieter falls over backwards, now lying on his bac the ground. Hysterical, he fights like hell to get to his feet, SCREA shaking, swatting the compys loose. He spins, and that ta seems to work, as the compys themselves begin to panic an drop off of him. But he also loses his grip on his weapon which goes flying, landing in the thick foliage five or s feet from him. Losing the attack, the compys turn and dart away en masse stopping ten yards away from him. But they turn and regroup, facing him in a line, hopping and down, CHIRPING and SHRIEKING. Dieter bounds into the foliage, looking for his gun. But compys follow him in and he's forced to flee, abandoning lost weapon. Ten feet on, he stops, knowing he's screwed without the g He turns to face the pursuing compys. They stop. Dieter charges them, SHOUTING, waving his arms. The compys turn and run. Dieter stops. The compys stop. They stare back at him. There is a momen of quiet, then they start to hop again, CHIRPING and SQUEALING. Dieter, tired of this game, turns and runs away. The compys follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the front of the convoy, ROLAND SHOUTS out.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Break's over, move on! The exhausted marchers drag themselves back to their feet start to march again. At the rear of the group, someone t Carter, who is still listening to his music. Carter gets hoists his backpack, and marches away. Behind him, Dieter's pack is left, forgotten, on the jung trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIETER stumbles along, exhausted. He reaches the edge of stream that runs under the foliage, and his feet slip on stones. He falls, into the rocky stream. Behind him, the army of compys pours over the little hill just crested. They disappear for a moment, down an inclin -- And then swarm over his body. In a frenzy of splashing Dieter shrugs them off and crawls away, through the strea He gets to his feet but falls again, this time over a log geyser of water splashes up in the air behind the log as Dieter drops out of sight. The compys leap over the log and disappear from view too, throwing up their own splashes of water. SCREECHING, CHIRPING, and the sound of TEARING flesh mixes with Diete SCREAMS. Now, as more compys leap over the log and splash into the water below, the geysers that shoot up into our field of are pink. And then they're a deep, deep red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group has stopped again. Near the rear, SARAH, NICK, MALCOLM, LUDLOW, and ROLAND are in a tense conversation w CARTER.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: How long ago was this?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Seven, eight minutes. Roland looks at them, thinking. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Then he's dead. Nobody tells the little girl. Last thing we need is screaming hysterics. He turns and heads back to the front of the column.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We have to send someone to look for him!

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: You go if you like, but we're not waiting for you. MOVE IT OUT!! They look at each other, appalled, but the column starts move. Numbed, shocked, but left with no choice, they mov one by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The column of MARCHERS has finally reached the island rid where they are silhouetted against the setting sun. They' taking a break, sprawled out on rocks or over the ground. MALCOLM sits next to KELLY, who's sitting on a log.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You okay? She doesn't look at him, just gets up and walks away, goi sit over next to SARAH. Malcolm watches, pained, but Sarah puts an arm around her makes a "she's okay" gesture to Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE RIDGE,
dialogues.text: ROLAND steps up to the very edge and peers into the islan interior. From his vantage point, he's able to see all th way to the far side of the island, a rim of herd black cl miles away. Between here and the cliffs there is nothing gently undulating jungle. He refers to one of the satellite recon photos.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Looks like the worker village is down in there, about a mile and a half northeast from the base of these cliffs. MALCOLM is next to him.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: There must be a game trail, some kind of path that goes down there. Roland looks around at the exhausted MARCHERS.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: They'll have to rest before we look for it. Eat. Sleep. Two hours. Then we hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group has made camp in the jungle. The mood is somber most of the MARCHERS asleep already. Three or four tents  been put up.

dialogues.speaker: IN ONE TENT,
dialogues.text: KELLY sits quietly in a corner, her eyes wide, knees hugg to his chest. SARAH comes in.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: There you are. Your dad's looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I doubt that. Sarah takes off her outer shirt and hangs it over a bar t the broad red smear across its front.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. Go talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Why? He likes to be alone. I can stay with you.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAMPSITE,
dialogues.text: all is still. The nocturnal jungle HOOTS and BUZZES aroun the sleeping marchers. In his tent, ROLAND abruptly sits up. As if he heard something. He looks out the open flap. In the middle of t campsite, he sees AJAY stop in his tracks, head cocked. Roland gets up and goes outside, joining Ajay in the midd the camp.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: You hear something?

dialogues.speaker: AJAY
dialogues.text: No. I feel something. Roland looks at him. This isn't so good. He looks out at shifting jungle. He notices a thin plume of smoke rising over the trees just barely outside the edge of camp.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: IN SARAH'S TENT,
dialogues.text: Kelly and Sarah have laid down on top of sleeping bags, t to get a few minutes' rest. Sarah's shirt hangs over them swaying in the gentle breeze coming through the open flap As the shirt dangles there, swinging softly from side to we notice the broad red smear across the front. Oh, that'  right -- it's blood. The baby T-rex's blood.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE RIDGE OF CAMP,
dialogues.text: the thin plume of smoke leads down to a tiny cooking fire that's been lit by DR. BURKE. He's set a small frying pan on top of it, and now he CRAC the dinosaur egg he picked up earlier into the pan. Roland and Ajay run up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: (hisses)

dialogues.speaker: ARE YOU OUT OF YOUR MIND
dialogues.text: Burke leaps out of the way as Roland kicks dirt on the fi

dialogues.speaker: BMBB
dialogues.text: Roland, Ajay, and Burke all freeze. What was that?

dialogues.speaker: IN SARAH'S TENT,
dialogues.text: Sarah and Kelly sit up. They felt it too.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Get my weapon. Ajay turns and trots away a few steps, then stops cold, staring down at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: BMBB
dialogues.text: A recent rain has all left puddles scattered around the c impact tremors now create ripples in the puddles -- conce circles spreading to the outer edges.

dialogues.speaker: IN SARAH'S TENT,
dialogues.text: Sarah and Kelly are frantically sealing up any opened foo into Ziploc bags.

dialogues.speaker: BMBB
dialogues.text: Now they leap into Sarah's sleeping bag, to seal themselv and draw the zipper up, all the way around. Outside, the silhouette of the rex's head passes by the t Sarah works faster, her fingers struggling to close the few inches, but -- -- the rex head pokes through the flap of the tent. It sniffs, SNORTING the air in and out. It looks around the tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sniffs Sarah's hanging shirt, the one that is stained the blood of the baby tyrannosaur. The adult tyrannosaur GURGLES again, COOING and cocking its head curiously. In the sleeping bag, Sarah and Kelly's eyes are barely visible, wide in panic. The rex sniffs and nudges the bag trying to figure out what this thing is. It rolls the bag over once, decides it's uninteresting, a then rises, straights up -- -- taking the whole tent with it! The stakes pop out of t ground as the tent rises high up into the air and flutter away, leaving the sleeping bag fully exposed on the groun beneath it.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAMPSITE,
dialogues.text: the SECOND TYRANNOSAUR now steps out of the jungle, joini the first. Panic hits the camp as the sleeping HUNTERS wa up. Many of them start to run. Roland scrambles toward his tent, where he can see his we lying near the open flap. As he draws close, an enormous T-rex foot stomps down on the tent, driving the rifle dee into the mud. Roland, weaponless, stands frozen, watching as the panick Hunters flee in all directions.

dialogues.speaker: FOR CHRIST'S SAKE, DON'T RUN
dialogues.text: But they ignore him, sweeping him up in the wave of flush prey that pours across the campsite. Some toss random and ill-aimed GUNSHOTS back at the rexes.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE CAMPSITE,
dialogues.text: NICK bursts out of the crowd, sees Kelly and Sarah strugg to get out of the sleeping bag, and grabs each by an arm. rips them to their feet and sweeps them off ahead of him, the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MIDDLE OF THE CROWD,
dialogues.text: MALCOLM, blinking back sleep, stands a good head above th rest of the panicking crowd. Frantically, he scans the gr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he can't see her.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE EDGE OF CAMP,
dialogues.text: the two rexes join forces, herding the fleeing Hunters in narrow ravine.

dialogues.speaker: UP ON A ROCK RACE,
dialogues.text: Roland scrambles up a steep rock face. No way in hell he' going down that ravine. He sees Malcolm, still in the mid of the camp, start to head for the ravine.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Malcolm runs over and hurls himself at the rock face, scrambling to climb up the smooth, steep boulders. Behind him, one of the rexes spots him and lunges across camp toward him. ROLAND (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: FASTER
dialogues.text: Malcolm gives it everything he's got, clawing his way up rock face -- -- and rex draws closer and pounces at his legs -- -- and Roland reaches down, grabs Malcolm by the hair and pulls him up, out of the rex's grasp. The rex falls short, but he's close enough that we can he his teeth SNAP together, closing around nothing but air. turns, sees easier prey in the fleeing Hunters, and takes after them. Malcolm lands on top of the rock ledge with a CRUNCH. Rol unceremoniously dumps a fistful of hair in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RAVINE,
dialogues.text: Kelly, in the middle of the fleeing crowd with Sarah and hears her father screaming her name and looks up. Malcolm Roland are on the rock ridge above them, keeping pace.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, UP HERE
dialogues.text: But Kelly continues to flee, as the rexes are in the ravi now, and drawing closer to the group. Some Hunters try to leap up and scale the rocks, but the ravine is deepening, there's no way out. One rex grabs h of a Hunter in its teeth and hurls him against the rock f The second rex picks up another Hunter and snaps its mass head left and right quickly, to break its victim's neck. Hunter goes flying forward and crashes into -- -- CARTER, Dieter's driver, who stumbles and falls. The r of the fleeing humans run around or over him, but when th rex lifts its foot, we see Carter is actually stuck to th bottom of it -- -- and when the animal takes its next step it CRUSHES him the earth.

dialogues.speaker: UP ON TH ROCK FACE,
dialogues.text: Malcolm is frantic.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I gotta get down there!

dialogues.speaker: DOWN IN THE RAVINE,
dialogues.text: it's obvious no one is going to outrun the rexes, and Nic knows it. He bursts ahead of Sarah and Kelly and spots something off to his left. It's a waterfall, apparently right in front of a sheer ro face. But there's something about the way the water is falling that tells him something.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH KELLY COME HERE
dialogues.text: He grabs each of them and hauls them forward, running str at the waterfall. Apparently, he intends to jump right in the rock, and he's dragging them along with him.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP
dialogues.text: The three of them spring right at the waterfall and disap THROUGH the water. DR. BURKE, fleeing along with everyone else, is watching they vanish.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE WATERFALL,
dialogues.text: there is a small recess, which is what Nick had hoped for It's small, only four or five feet deep, but it's just en for him, Sarah, and Kelly to cover behind the flowing wat Breathless, terrified, they can hear the mayhem outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh... shhhh... With an enormous SPLASH, something bursts through the cascading water and crashes into them. Dr. Burke.

dialogues.speaker: BURKE
dialogues.text: Get out of the way! He pulls his way up against the far wall, as far away fro water as he can. FOOOOM! Now another shape bursts through the watery curta A Tyrannosaur head. Burke gave away the hiding spot. The four SCREAM as the rex's jaws SNAP left and right, searching for them, falling just inches short. They squee as far back against the wall as they can get. The rex can't quite get its head all the way through the opening -- -- so it uses its tongue. A long, dark blue shape slither out of its mouth and touches the humans, trying to wrap a them, to pull them out of the cave. Burke, blind with panic, forces himself even further into cave, which pushes Kelly further out.

dialogues.speaker: STOP IT YOU'RE PUSHED HER OUT STOP
dialogues.text: It! But Burke doesn't listen, throwing elbows to make room fo himself. His movements dislodge a portion of muddy earth, a flurry of enormous cockroaches, eight or nine inches lo each, pour out of the wall and swarm over his face and ne Burke SCREAMS and instinctively leaps away, toward the fl water. And that's all the leverage the rex needs. It curls its tongue, wrapping Burke up in it and pulling him between i teeth. SCREAMING hideously, he is dragged out, through th waterfall, and disappears. Sarah, Nick, and Kelly stare in horror as the white scree water turn pink.

dialogues.speaker: UP ON THE ROCK FACE,
dialogues.text: Malcolm and Roland see the rex walk away from the waterfa with Burke, leaving the hiding place unmolested. Malcolm  nearly hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: She's okay! They'll stay in there, she's okay!

dialogues.speaker: IN A JUNGLE CLEARING,
dialogues.text: routed Hunters emerge from the gully at the edge of he jungle. Ahead of them, there is a large open plain covere long "elephant" grass. AJAY, running along with them, stops abruptly at the edge the grass, SHOUTING to the others.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Not in the frenzy, they ignore him. Behind Ajay, the enor shadows of the two pursuing tyrannosaurs stop as well, ho up at the edge of the jungle. Ajay, torn between a sense of responsibility and his bett judgement, opts for the former and races into the grass a the other Hunters, waving his arms.

dialogues.speaker: UP ABOVE THEM,
dialogues.text: Roland and Malcolm come out onto a rocky ledge that has a of the plain below. Roland can see the Hunters leaving tr as they plow through the grass.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Elephant grass!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PLAIN,
dialogues.text: the groups of Hunters wades into the middle of the long g One of them stops and turns, looking back at the jungle t

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: They gave up! They're not chasing us! There are CHEERS, SIGHS OF relief. In the distance, AJAY' VOICE can be heard, faintly calling to them to come back. on the rock in the distance, they can see Roland, waving arms madly. But in the giddiness of their escape, they pay it no mind They continue plowing into the high grass, anything to ge further away from the tyrannosaurs.

dialogues.speaker: ABOUT FIFTY YARDS AWAY,
dialogues.text: the tops of three animal heads rise up slowly, backlit by the full moon. In the distance, the heads can seethe Hunt  party. The heads descend, back into the grass.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH THE HUNTERS,
dialogues.text: they continue forward, oblivious. Now behind them, four more heads rise up in the grass. As then descend. On all sides of the Hunters, the grass ripples as animals forward toward them, undetected, inexorable as torpedoes. And these torpedoes are on target. One Hunter is suddenly dragged down, yanked silently below the surface of the ta grass. In his place, a long, lizard-like tail rises up as the an drops its head to make the kill. Behind him, two more Hunters are taken down, and two more animal tails rise up in their place. A Hunter ahead hears RUSTLING and turns. His face turns white as, behind him - -- a VELOCIRAPTOR springs out of the grass. Velociraptor runs upright on its powerfully muscled hind the second tow of each foot bearing an extra-large curved claw, carried in a retracted position, with which it slas on attack. Like now. This raptor SNARLS and SLAMS into the body of t Hunter, taking him down. A feeding frenzy ensues. The Hunters run in all directions, but are pulled down and va into the twitching long grass. Another raptor enters from the right, leaps high into the past the full moon, SLAMS into the chest of more human pr and takes him down, into the grass. Behind them, Ajay's face falls, defeated. He looks around realizing he too is now stranded in the middle of the lon grass. Around him, four torpedo trails head straight for him. Ajay simply closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: UP ON THE ROCK,
dialogues.text: Roland turns away from the carnage, pained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH, MALCOLM, KELLY, NICK, ROLAND, DR. JUTTSON, and PET LUDLOW stand in the ruins of their campsite, their ranks decimated, spirits shattered. Roland is at the hole in the ground where his tent once He has pulled his .800 Nitro Express from the mud and mor less cleaned it, now he's checking the loads. Kelly, nearly catatonic with fear, clings to Sarah, and i doesn't look as if she'll ever let go. Malcolm, who is on knees picking through the wreckage of a tent, looks over them, but Sarah waves him off -- "she's okay." Roland appears, standing over the group. He looks at Malc who has found the Lindstradt rifle, intact.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: How many rounds did you find for that weapon?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Four, counting the one in the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Don't let it out of your hands again. (to Sara, but looking at Kelly) Can the kid walk?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ask her.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Can the kid walk?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I can. I can walk. While he addresses the group, Roland straps on one of the servo-lights, the shoulder-mounted flashlights that follo your gaze.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: We're going to find a path down into the interior of the island. Load up whatever you think you need, and I mean need. If you can't carry it indefinitely, don't bring it. We'll hit the worker village in a couple hours and be out of here before dawn.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE EDGE OF CAMP,
dialogues.text: Roland bends over one of the three-toed footprints left b rex. Behind him, the rest of the group is packing up, slinging the remnants of their equipment over their shoul Roland bends over and SNIFFS the footprint. It's filled w a liquid of some kind.
