He takes his canteen, dumps the remaining water into the ground, and plunges the canteen into the footprint, filli it. Ludlow hovers over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Piss. Ludlow doesn't ask.

dialogues.speaker: NOW AT THE FIRE,
dialogues.text: Roland stares down at the ashes of the cooking fire that to such disaster. He grabs a handful of the ash and shove in his pants pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROLAND and LUDLOW (who, along with Sarah and Malcolm, is wearing a servo-light now) maneuver down a rugged hillsid come out in a flattened area. Ludlow GASPS, looking ahead wonderment. MALCOLM breaks through the hillside's foliage moment later. He too stares in amazement. SARAH and KELLY come next, then NICK, then JUTTSON. One b one, they all stop and stare.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: God help us. They're standing in a flat, sandy area lined with boulder the sides. The flat area stretches fifty yards from side side and as far as they can see ahead. But that's not wha amazes them so. Everywhere, the sand is dotted with dinosaur skeletons. S are huge, apatosaurs, sixty feet from head to tail tip. Others are smaller, herbivores of many different kinds. T more intact skeletons lie on their sides, their ribcages of pale bone. but just as many have been ripped apart, bi of carcass tossed in every direction.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I do not feel lucky.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Keep moving. They march on, tiny figures moving among the mountainous skeletons by the light of the full moon. Roland notices o carcass in particular, a recent kill. It's an enormous HADROSAUR with fresh bites taken out of it.  He bends down, studying the soft earth around it for footprints.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER ON,
dialogues.text: Malcolm looks up, noticing the bony shapes around them, w fall in heavy shadows like cell bars, seem to be changing He turns, and his servo-light shines on the bones. But they're not bones any more at all, they're pipes, the ani graveyard now given over to the lifeless skeletons of man objects -- twisted, rotting machinery.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: We made it! They hurry over a small rise --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and find themselves at the edge of what was once Isla Sorna's worker village. The size of a football field, the town is divided by a main street that's dotted on both si by stores, residences, cafes, a gas station. All the way the far end is a large, blocky, four-story building. But the town is a mess. The hurricane that hit here must been ferocious, for everywhere things are smashed, broken upended. And the jungle has stepped into the breath, grow up, around, and over everything. Huge root systems snake through the street, making it almost impassable.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: The jungle. It's always ready to return. Roland catches up and looks at Ludlow.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Where's the power and radio setup?

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Operations building. Far end of the street. A light rain falls as they start down the street, careful silently, Roland and Malcolm with their weapons at the re They pass the skeleton of a fallen water tower. An empty station, its vine-snarled pumps now useless. The only sou is the low mechanical HUM of the servo-lights as they fol the group's gazes obediently. Every few feet, the group encounters strange, grayish lum that lies in random places in the middle of the street. Malcolm, curious, stops and taps one of them. It's a rock Nick looks over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lava?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What are they?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I don't know. Finally, they reach the operation building, at the far en the town.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: The radio rig is inside. It runs directly from the geothermal generator, so power shouldn't be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Good. He pulls out his canteen. Ludlow watches as he screws the off, moves toward the building, and starts splashing the contents on the outside of it. The rest of the group just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: What's he got in there?

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Piss.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Don't ask me. The guy's completely out to lunch.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What in God's name would he want with- Roland rejoins them.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Tyrannosaur urine. I don't want anything to do with it, and neither does any other animal on this island. This building is now demarcated as the rex's territory. As long as you stay in that building, you'll all be  safe until the helicopter comes. He drops his pack, swings his gun off his shoulder, and c the load. Dr. Juttson looks fearful.

dialogues.speaker: JUTTSON
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: After the rex. I saw a fresh kill back in the valley with tyrannosaur tracks all around it. If I'm not back in time, don't wait for me.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You've got to be kidding.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Runs against my nature to hole up in a cave and wait.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Do you think the rex might have the infant with it?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Possible. Ludlow takes off his hat and turns to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: You know how to work a radio, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're going too?

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: I lost everything I came after on this trip, but one T-rex in one theme park could single-handedly bail InGen out of Chapter 11. He takes a slip of paper from the brim of his hat and han to Nick. LUDLOW (cont'd) This is the broadcast frequency. ID yourself as "Harvest Leader." You know what to tell ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You gentlemen feel you have to do this now?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Now's the perfect time. The animal  just fed, so it won't stalk us for food. Predators don't hurt when they're not hungry. Ludlow double checks the clip on his semi-automatic rifle

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No. -- and SMACKS it back into the belly of the gun. NICK (cont'd) Only humans do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The console of a sophisticated radio set-up glows brightl all green, red, and yellow. NICK tunes the dial to a spec frequency. The radio WHINES and HISSES tuning in.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (into microphone) cQ, CQ. This is InGen Operation Harvest Leader to Harvest Base. Come in, please. The remaining SURVIVORS, minus Ludlow and Roland, shine t flashlights around the dusty, vine-hung interior of the communications room. On the wall a row of chrome letters "We Make The Future," but the words are obscured by a tan of vines. Mushrooms and fungi sprout from the carpet. On one wall, there is a mural of what the completed Juras Park would have looked like. Big hotels, Ford Explorers w tourists leaning out the windows taking pictures, big cro at the fences around the animal exhibits. But none of it true, and now even the mural is runny and dust-covered. There is a pause, filed only with radio static. Sarah loo at Nick tensely, waiting. Finally, a VOICE comes over the radio, clean as can be. VOICE (0.s.) Go ahead, Harvest Leader. They all breath a sign of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Roland and Ludlow gone on the hunt and the rest of t group inside the operations building, main street stands deserted and silent. Nearly deserted, anyway. Moonlight shadows lengthen at o end of the street -- -- and FIVE VELOCIRAPTORS STROLL INTO TOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROLAND AND LUDLOW are back in the valley of death, standi amid the giant skeletons of long-dead animals. Roland ben down, checking the carcass of the freshly-chewed HADROSAU saw earlier. A set of giant three-toed rex tracks leads away from the carcass, down the stream bed. Roland follows them. Ludlow follows Roland. As they near a bend in the stream, Roland looks down, at surface of the water. A pattern of ripples moves toward t washing over their ankles. Roland follows the ripples wit his eyes. From up head, around the bend, he can hear the sound of an animal eating and drinking. A very large anim He reaches into his pocket and pulls out a pinch of the a from the cooking fire that he scooped up earlier and rele that on the wind. They float there for a second, suspende then blow back at him.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: We're downwind. Good. Roland darts a contemptuous look at him. He puts a finger his lips, gesturing for silence, then steps up, onto the shore. Ludlow follows. They creep forward, toward the sounds. They round the ben and Roland hits his belly, edging up over a small rise. Over the rise, he sees the TYRANNOSAUR, about a hundred y ahead. It's stooped over the stream bed, drinking. Like a bird, it dips its head in the water and then straightens to let the water fall down its throat. A dozen COMPYS are the water as well, drinking. Roland gently FLICKS the safety on his gun to "off." Ludlow edges toward the cover of a low-hanging branch. As puts his weight on one knee, it presses down hard on the middle of a small stick, which CRACKS in half. Roland tur eyes blazing. Out in the open, the tyrannosaur snaps its head sharply a well, staring in the direction of the sound. But since Roland's own head is turned, he doesn't see the dinosaur' reaction. Roland holds a warning finger out to Ludlow.  Roland turns his head back. The tyrannosaur is gone.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER ON,
dialogues.text: the trail of three-toed tyrannosaur footprints stops abru Roland stops too, gesturing for Ludlow to freeze behind h Roland glances both ways, looking for any sign of the tra To the right, the ground gives way to hard black volcanic A short distance behind them, the rock is solid, a massiv green, pebbled boulder ten feet high. Roland frowns and WHISPERS in Ludlow's ear again.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: We took to the rock.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Why? In front of Roland, a palm frond sways gently in the nigh breeze. Roland's eyes widen. He pulls out another pinch o campfire ash and releases it on the wind. This time, the ash blows off, straight away from him.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Wind shift. They freeze, terrified. Behind them, the enormous green pebbled boulder -- -- opens an eye. That's no boulder, that's the MALE TYRANNOSAUR, standing rock-solid still, its natural camouflage blending into th surrounding foliage perfectly. Very slowly and almost silently, the rex brings its head all the way around unti is staring directly down at them from about ten feet away Roland and Ludlow stand frozen, their back to the rex, unaware of its presence. Until it exhales. The soft SNORT of its breath isn't quit audible, but it brushes the hair on the backs of their ne ever so slightly. Their hearts drop into their stomachs. Ludlow speaks, his voice a queasy HISS.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: It's... behind... us.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: (the very softest whisper) It's just fed. It won't attack unless it's threatened. Don't move. As the rex silently cocks its head, sizing up the danger these intruders, it breathes again. A few strands of Ludl hair flap in the exhalation. He closes his eyes, near tea He can't take it. His eyes dart, glancing down at the wea he holds in his hands. Unfortunately, it's extended in fr of him, away from the rex. He risks another HISS.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: If I don't move, I can't shoot it.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Let it go, Peter. The animal won. Behind them, the rex appears satisfied. It starts to swin its massive head around, back toward the jungle. It lifts great leg and takes a step into the trees. Roland signs and closes his eyes, relieved. But Ludlow seizes the opportunity. He whips his weapon ar and drops to one knee. ROLAND (cont'd) no! The rex is infinitely quicker. Ludlow just has time to squeeze off a short burst of semi-automatic gunfire when animal whirls, takes one elegant step forward, and POUNCE Ludlow's bullets rip harmlessly through the foliage betwe the rex's legs as its big head snaps forward and comes do jaws wide. They close around Ludlow's body, lift his stra up into the air, and toss him once, readjusting their gri it is firmly around his midsection. The whole combination of movements takes but half a secon By the time Roland turns around, the animal has pivoted a darted back into the jungle, carrying Ludlow, still SCREA and writhing in its mouth. Roland raises his gun, to draw a bead on the animal, but through the shivering trees, he can only see that the tyrannosaur is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALCOLM SARAH, NICK, KELLY, and DR. JUTTSON wait nervousl the communications room. An empty can of Dr. Pepper sitti on one of the countertops begins to RATTLE. They look ove it, confused, as the lightweight aluminum can CHATTERS on formica counter.  Other objects in the lab begin to rattle too. Glass jars CLANK against one another, books start to drop off the shelves, a stool shudders across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: What's going on?! Above them, the rotting wooden roof of the building start actually tear away, chunks of moldy timber flying up into the night. They look up, a deafening ROAR fills the room -- and a helicopter's searchlight floods in! As the chopper dips lower, looking for a place to land, t violent prop wash rips away huge chunks of the roof over heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up above the operations building, the helicopter circles. roof of the building is all arches and rotten timber, impossible to land open. Below, the PILOTS see the SURVIVORS through the torn roof the building. They wave frantically, their flashlight bea piercing the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: There they are! The Co-Pilot scans the street below, but it's choked with overturned cars and fallen trees.

dialogues.speaker: CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: No LZ in the street, too much debris!

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Check the other buildings! The Co-Pilot nods and they peel off, swooping over the re the village. At the far end of the street, the Co-Pilot brings the searchlight to bear on the large, flat roof of a three st building. The Pilot gives him a thumbs-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALCOLM, SARAH, KELLY, NICK and finally DR. JUTTSON run o the front of the operations building. At the end of the street, they can see the helicopter as it descends slowly the building, to land on its roof.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: There it is! Happily, the group double-times it down the street, head the chopper. Again, those strange rock formations are everywhere. Some seem to be on the sides of buildings, as they once dripped there and then turned to stone. This time Sarah pauses at one that is dripping over to th of a car like solidified lava. Her face falls as a though occurs to her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ian. It's guano.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: These formations. They're dried --

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Birdshit? A VELOCIRAPTORS jumps onto a fallen tree trunk behind the They don't see it.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Who cares? Let's go! Unaware of the raptor's presence, they resume their trot toward the helicopter. Behind them, the raptor crouches a SNARLS, but the sound is lost under the WHINE of the helicopter's engines. It springs, covering the distance between them quickly. The animal SLAMS into JUTTSON, the last person in the gro and takes him down. Juttson is thrown forward, into the others, who fall like dominoes. Juttson SCREAMS, his voice an unnatural, high-pitched SQU as the raptor flips him over and lowers its jaws into him Sarah looks up, panicked. Her eyes widen at the sight of SECOND RAPTOR, this one running straight at hr at top spe She buries her face in the dirt, covering her head with h hands -- -- and the raptor's foot SLAMS into the ground between he legs as it bounds over her and dives onto Juttson, joinin first raptor in the kill. Panicked, the group scatters in all directions. Kelly jum up and scrambles into the middle of the street, where she the dirt and crawls under a fallen shed in the middle of road. Malcolm rolls over to the space where Kelly was, but she'  gone now. He looks around frantically.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Kelly?! KELLY?! Sarah rolls onto her feet and sprints toward the building nearest her. Behind her, a THIRD RAPTOR gives chase, bounding after he with horrifying speed. Sarah runs flat-out, but her speed nothing compared to the raptor's, and it gains on her rap The walls of a structure of some kind close in around Sar and as she leaps across a leather seat and SLAMS a door b her, we realize she's crawled into the back seat of an abandoned car. But the car door is thin protection against the charging raptor, which SLAMS into the window, head first. The wind spinderwebs, but does not yield. The raptor crumples to t ground. Sarah looks up, through a three inch hole in the middle o web. The raptor leaps back to its feet and plunges its no into the tiny hole, thrashing, widening it. Sarah SCREAMS and the animal forces its entire head throu the hole, SNAPPING its jaws just short of her face. She hurls herself over the seat and into the front as the animal penetrates even further into the car, but its tors will not fit through the window opening. It pulls away. In the front seat, Sarah gets some very bad news. There's no windshield. The raptor springs up onto the hood, its claws CLATTERING the sheet metal, and tosses its body through the opening -- just as Sarah hurls herself out the door. While the ra struggles to right itself in the front seat, Sarah runs t nearest building, ducks inside, and SLAMS the heavy woode door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALCOLM races between the idled gas pumps and into the ga station building, closing the door behind him. A moment later, a raptor bounds after him, SLAMMING into the door. Meeting resistance, it bounces off, notices the plate gla window next to the door, and pounces at that. The window SHATTERS and the raptor clings to the ledge, staring insi its tail hanging out. Just as it gets inside, Malcolm opens the door and comes out, keeping the place of wall between them. He pulls the Lindstradt rifle off his back and tries to take aim -- -- but the raptor whirls and springs, forcing him back in through the door again. Willing to play along, the raptor turns and jumps through window again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balancing on the window frame, the raptor HISSES and crou ready to spring at Malcolm. Malcolm takes cover behind the door, which is hanging ope between them. He raises the rifle. Th raptor springs into the door, BLASTING it off its hing knocking Malcolm right through a window behind him. But the door SMACKS up against the wall, covering the win preventing the raptor from following Malcolm out that way For the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm flies through the window and CRUNCHES to the grou He GROANS in agony and rolls off his bad leg, which is tw unnaturally beneath him, and claws in the mud for the gun ROUGH HANDS reach down, grab him by the shirt, and haul h his feet. It's NICK. He drags Malcolm away, but in the commotion Nick's duffel slips off his shoulder and lands the street, spilling some of the precious videotapes. Malcolm scoops them up.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Where's Kelly?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: She's with Sarah! They race off, down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High above SARAH, we see she is standing alone in a three story kiln house, a windowless shed used for firing potte and other construction projects. Catwalks lined with hea chains hang above her, and onto the floor below, she turn circles, wondering what to do now. From outside the kiln house, she hears SCRATCHING, diggin sounds. From the other side of the door comes an animal SNORT, and a small puff of dust and dirt billows up throu the crack along the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DOOR,
dialogues.text: the claws of one of the raptors dig furiously, trying to tunnel underneath.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE,
dialogues.text: Sarah runs to the opposite wall, falls to her knees, and starts digging a tunnel of her own, clawing frantically a ganging tools always and CLANKS as it tears at the earth it. Sarah digs faster. So does the raptor. With about eight inches of space under the wall, Sarah gr hold of the bottom of one of the plans and pries it up as hard as she can. It snaps off with a loud CRACK. At the door, the raptor stops digging. It's silent for a moment . Sarah has a good foot and a half of space under her wall She starts to lower her body into it --

dialogues.speaker: SIDE
dialogues.text: Sarah falls back, SCREAMING, leaps to her feet, and jumps grabbing hold of one of the catwalks above. She starts to climb, up, anywhere up, as the RAPTOR now squirms and thr its way inside, coming in through her hole. Sarah climbs, hauling herself up, leaping from one catwal another. The raptor leaps up onto a catwalk as well and follows he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A window in the slanted roof of the kiln house EXPLODES i shower of glass as SARAH kicks through it and climbs outs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick drags a badly limping MALCOLM down the main street. can see helicopter at the far end, engine ROARING and  searchlight playing over them as they draw closer. They approach a rusted, abandoned pickup in the middle of the street -- -- and a RAPTOR leaps on top of it. Its claws CLACK on th roof as it goes into its pre-attack crouch. They don't stick around to negotiate. Nick hauls Malcolm into the nearest building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK and MALCOLM hurry inside and SLAM the door behind th They're standing in the lobby of a hotel of some kind, probably used for overnight guests and day workers who ha spend the night. The room and staircase wind around a lar open-aired central area four stories tall. They SHOUT at other, frantic.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: We can't stay in here!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: We're sure as hell not going back out there"

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: This is single-wall construction! It's just a shack!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It'll hold!

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: For sixty seconds, maybe! Look at this! (RAPS on the door with his knuckles) You could- With a CRASH, the wood SPRINTERS around the lock and the swings open violently. Malcolm is thrown aside, landing h on the floor. A VELOCIRAPTOR stands HISSING in the doorway. Nick throws weight against the door. SLAMMING it hard against the rap Malcolm rolls over and paws the gun off his back. SLAM! The raptor charges the door again, this time BLASTI it off its hinges, knocking Nick to the floor beneath it. raptor turns and SNARLS at Malcolm. Malcolm swings the gun around -- -- the raptor lunges at him --  -- Malcolm's finger closes on the trigger -- -- and the raptor lands on top of him. The weight of the animal CRUSHES him into the floor, but gun barrel now stands between them. The raptor CHOMPS dow hard on the barrel, its teeth GRINDING on the metal, and its head, to tear it from Malcolm's hands. Malcolm pulls the trigger. The raptor's eyes pop wide as the dart SLAMS into the bac its throat. It makes a GURGLING sound, then convulses violently and rolls off of Malcolm, yanking the gun from hands as it falls and dies. Nick scrambles out from under the door. Malcolm tries to wrench the gun from the raptor's clenched jaws, but it wo budge.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (helping him out) Head for the roof!

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I have to find Kelly!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I think she's with Sarah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KELLY remains huddled under the fallen shed, trembling wi fear. She holds her breath and freezes, as just outside, two feet from where she's hiding -- -- a RAPTOR'S FEET pick their way past her, down the midd the street. Kelly closes her eyes and suppresses a scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK and MALCOLM burst onto the roof of the now-burning hotel and SLAM the door behind them. The helicopter is no only three rooftops away. They turn and head for it, Nick the lead, but there's an eight foot gap between the build

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: It's too wide!  Nick looks around, desperate. A fallen power pole leans against the building they're standing on, its lines gone slack.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Help me push this! Malcolm understands. He and Nick throw a shoulder into th pole and give it a mighty push, tipping it over in the ot direction. One good hard shove and it falls to the far building, THUDDING against it solidly. Its power lines are not taut, a lifeline from this roofto the next. Nick grabs hold and starts to pull himself acro the gap, hand over hand. Behind them, the door of the building SPLINTERS and CRASH open as a raptor throws all its weight into it. Malcolm l onto the power line without hesitation and starts pulling himself across. But even with the door wide open, the raptor on the other hesitates. It SNARLS and backs away, refusing to come out onto the roof.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OTHER ROOFTOP,
dialogues.text: Malcolm lands next to Nick on the second rooftop. They lo back at the frightened animal, which takes tow steps out the roof, SNARLS, and backs into the doorway again.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It's afraid to come onto the roof! Malcolm looks around, at the rooftop. Strange bits of scr and debris seem to have been arranged there, in an odd, concentric pattern.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Look! Sarah! He points to the roof of the kilm house, in the distance. Malcolm turns, and sees SARAH crawling across the tile. H face turns white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH has problems. Still on top of the kilm house, she reaches the edge and pushes off the roof, leaping to the of the next building. She lands at the peak of the intersection of the two side sloping roof. As she pulls herself up -- -- a RAPTOR appears on the rooftop behind her. In full stride, it leaps, sails over her, and lands on the roof ahead of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah swings to her left and starts to crawl down the slo away from the raptor. Suddenly the roof board under her SPRINTERS and CRACKS under her weight. The whole section pulls up and starts to slide off the roof. Sarah, clingin it, rides the roof planks down, away from the raptor. She looks over her shoulder, down -- -- and sees ANOTHER RAPTOR, waiting for her on the roof o building below. Sarah quickly rolls off the sliding section of roof, whic keeps sliding, falling. The raptor below jumps up, just i time to get WHACKED in the head by the falling roof secti Sarah tries to cling to the Spanish tile roof, fingers an nails slipping on the slick ceramic surface. She slides a the way to the edge, grabs hold of the gutter, and dangle there, suspended above one raptor and trapped below anoth The raptor above works its way down. The one below leaps at her dangling legs. She has left them in time with its jumps, to avoid losing her feet. This can't go on for lon Desperate, she pulls one of the Spanish tiles up from the and hurls it at the raptor below. It hits the animal in t head, for all the good that does. But Sarah keeps on, pulling and throwing more tiles. She edges to the right, toward a fresh supply. The raptor above edges even closer, claws CLICKING on the slick roof. Something interesting is happening. As Sarah pulls the lo tiles free, the ones above slide down, to take their plac Sarah sees this and pulls more free, knocking them out of way as fast as she can. Suddenly an avalanche of loose tiles breaks loose and the footing underneath the raptor above disintegrates. The animal's feet flail and grasp, it slides towards the edge the tumbling tiles. Sarah, seeing it coming, swings in close to the building, hugging it as closely as she can. The raptor falls off th roof, right past her -- -- and CRUNCHES into the raptor below. Both animals SNAR attack one another. Now Sarah, her grip exhausted, falls too, landing right n to the enraged animals. They fight and roll, RIGHT OVER H She GROANS and hugs the wood below her, the raptors conti to thrash and bite, they roll back, toward her, she rolls of their way -- -- and plunges through a hole in the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah falls through the roof of a deserted laboratory and lands in the tray of an old-fashioned hanging fluorescent light fixture. One end of the fixture's support SNAPS, it drops at a 45 degree angle, Sarah slides out the other end and CRASHES through a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah lands in the mud in the street below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a THUD, MALCOLM lands in the mud between two other building, one of which he has just climbed off of. Panick he leaps to his feet and starts to SHOUT.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Kelly! KELLY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH sprints down the main street as fast as she can, to the building on which sits the helicopter. Above her, she see NICK has now reached the helicopter and is waving to Sarah reaches the fallen water tower, which is next to th helicopter building, and starts to climb it.

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE IN THE STREET,
dialogues.text: KELLY is still covering underneath the fallen shed. In th distance, she can see the helicopter. But she is tremblin with fear, unable to move. The whole shed suddenly RATTLES as something heavy hits i outside. Kelly's mouth drops open to scream, but her terr is so complex that no sound comes out. She raises her han in self-defense, whatever's outside ROARS with effort, t entire shed is suddenly RIPPED right up off of her, and s looks up -- -- into her father's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Come on! He grabs her by the hand and they take off down the stree

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOFTOP,
dialogues.text: Sarah emerges at the top of the water tower structure and leaps onto the roof, into Nick's arms.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Where's Kelly?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Where's Ian? Eyes wide with panic, they both turn and look down at the street below, where they see KELLY and MALCOLM, racing at speed down the middle of the street -- -- WITH A VELOCIRAPTOR CHASING THEM.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN IN THE STREET,
dialogues.text: Malcolm and Kelly have a twenty yard advantage on the ani They're pretty fast, but it's faster. Above them, Nick and Sarah are at the edge of the roof, SHOUTING and urging them on. They push it, faster. They reach the base of the fallen water tower, the jumble struts and metal poles that Sarah climbed.

dialogues.speaker: CLIMB
dialogues.text: Kelly leaps ahead of him and grabs hold of one of the pol pulling herself neatly up to her feet and reaching for th next one. Malcolm stretches and makes the same effort, but for him much harder. Below them, the raptor springs and SLAMS into the struts, shaking the whole structure. It pulls itself up. Higher up, Kelly climbs fast, hands gliding over the pole She breaks out into the open, where a long, narrow pole r on a slight incline up to the roof. She scampers across running the balance beam. She reaches the other side, on a ledge below the roofline looks back. Malcolm is at the other end, hesitating, drai breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, COME ON
dialogues.text: Below him, the raptor closes in. Malcolm sets out across beam, his legs shaking. He places his feet carefully, he doesn't have nearly the balance Kelly did. The raptor draws closer. KELLY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: FASTER
dialogues.text: Malcolm slips. One foot twists right off the bar and he spins, arms flai trying to regain his tenuous balance. But he overcompensates and his whole body, wrenches out f under him. He falls, the bar SMACKS him hard in the chest knocking the wind out of him, and he drops, flipping righ the bar and bouncing painfully through the maze of bars b He drops right past the pursuing velociraptor, CRUNCHING a halt in a nest of bars ten feet off the ground, probabl cracking a rib. Kelly SCREAMS from above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KELLY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: She stares down in horror at her father. Wrenched in amon the bars, Malcolm is helpless as the animal crouches only feet above him now, with an open attack route. The animal SNARKS and goes into its pre-attack crouch. Up above, Kelly wipes the palms of her hands on her jeans and leaps out into space, grabbing hold of one of the bar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The raptor springs. Kelly spins around, over the top of the bar, and, at the peak of her trajectory, she lets go. The raptor sails through down from above, feet first, SLA both of them squarely into the raptor's side, sending it hurtling into space. She lands hard and awkwardly, CLANGING into the spidery scaffolding next to Malcolm as the raptor SMASHES to the ground below. But Kelly manages to hold on.

dialogues.speaker: GET UP
dialogues.text: She grabs hold of Malcolm and pulls him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOF,
dialogues.text: Kelly and Malcolm appear over the roofline. The PILOTS SH from inside.

dialogues.speaker: LET'S GO LET'S GO LET'S GO
dialogues.text: Malcolm and Kelly scramble toward the helicopter. But at opposite side of the roof, a RAPTOR claws its way over th edge as well. Malcolm sees it and they lunge for the helicopter, but th animal is far faster. It's only ten feet away, then five, they're surely done for this time, when --

dialogues.speaker: -- KA-BOOM
dialogues.text: There comes the loudest single gunshot anyone has ever he and the raptor flies off its feet and lands ten feet acro the roof, dead. They look up, to the source of the gunshot. It's ROLAND, standing at the edge of the roof, holding hi smoking .600 Nitro Express. But there's no time for celebration, as suddenly the helicopter's left skid CRACKS right through the surface o roof.

dialogues.speaker: HURRY
dialogues.text: The skid dips even further, ripping right through the thatch-and-wood construction. Kelly, who had one foot in helicopter, loses her balance -- -- as the roof caves in beneath her.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: She falls, SCREAMING, through the hole and down, into the building below.

dialogues.speaker: ONE FLOOR DOWN,
dialogues.text: Kelly lands with a CRUNCH on the floor immediately below roof, about nine feet down. But her landing is cushioned an inordinate amount of straw and leaves that have been arranged there. She lifts one hand, and a yellowy, viscou  substance drips off of it. It's yolk. She looks around, noticing half a dozen large, oblong shapes. Eggs. Above her, Malcolm is scrambling, climbing down to her th the wreckage of the CREAKING, crumbling roof.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Kelly! I'm coming! Kelly climbs to her knees, but behind her, a large, dark is moving. Rising. Unfolding, in a way. IT'S A PTERANODON. Yep, flying dinosaur. The enormous animal raises its head brilliant blue crest extending two feet behind its long, saber-like beak. It SQUAWKS at Kelly in fury. She can onl stare, spellbound. Malcolm reaches her and grabs hold as the angry animal un its massive twenty-two foot wingspread.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOF,
dialogues.text: the helicopter lurches as it sinks further into the crumb roof, and now the skids are getting tangled in the debris Roland races over to the hole, climbs in a few feet, and starts kicking at it, making it larger.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Give me a ladder!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PTERANODON NEST,
dialogues.text: Malcolm tries to haul Kelly back up the way he came, but SECOND PTERANODON now appears from the depths of the buil SCREECHING in fury at these invaders who have landed in t middle of their clutch of eggs. An emergency rescue ladder drops through the hole in the Malcolm grabs Kelly with one arm and the ladder with the and they start to climb out of the nest.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOF,
dialogues.text: Malcolm and Kelly climb the ladder and are pulled into th belly of the chopper just as two enormous beaks break through the surface of the roof around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pteranodons are emerging.

dialogues.speaker: GO GO GO GO GOG GO
dialogues.text: The helicopter lurches up a few feet, but it yanked to an  abrupt stop. The engines WHINE, the chopper just hovers there.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: We're snagged on something! They loos down. BOTH PTERANODONS have come out through th hole in the roof and are clinging to the skids of the helicopter. They flap their gigantic wings in unison, and drag the helicopter off, into the air, away from the nest -- and let go. Freed, the helicopter gains altitude quick

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HELICOPTER,
dialogues.text: the PILOTS gape as the pteranodons coast along, right nex the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Hang on! If I tip it hard, I can cut "em with the rotors!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: NO! Don't! They're not attacking! They look out the windows, where, indeed, the magnificent animals are merely accompanying them, flying escort as th chopper gains altitude. SARAH (cont'd) They're protecting their nest. That's all. That's all they're doing. Kelly, completely drained, sits between Sarah and Malcolm each of whom has a protective arm around her. She sags against her father's chest, nothing left. He holds her tight and WHISPERS in her ear.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Thank you. Kelly, thank God. Thank God for you...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE NIGHT SKY,
dialogues.text: over the island, the helicopter steadily gains altitude. hundred feet. Three hundred. A thousand. As the helicopter is clearly leaving the island, the pteranodons now peel off, their job done. One of them ban sharply, right in front of the moon. The moonlight silhouettes it, shining right through its membranous wing lighting it up like a Halloween skeleton. Below, the tiny green island melts away into the vastness the wine-dark sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsewhere in the forest, it's not such a happy story. PET LUDLOW, still alive, drops through the air and CRUNCHES t muddy ground. Dizzy, bleeding, the breath knocked out of he opens his eyes and sees a sloping bank of dried mud. From behind him, he hears a CHIRPING sound. He turns. He's in the tyrannosaur nest. The BABY TYRANNOSAUR faces him, still with a strange aluminum-foil cast on its leg. The baby SQUEAKS with excitement as it toddles toward him. Ludlow scrambles to his feet, unsure what to do. Both ADU TYRANNOSAURS stand outside the nest, staring down at him. The baby runs toward Ludlow, so he turns and runs away. But in an instant, the male brings its head down, knockin Ludlow to the ground. Then it raises its head again. Watching. Waiting. Ludlow gets up again and tries to run, but now the female strikes, knocking him over again. Ludlow tries to crawl away, on all fours. The male bends and closes its jaws around one of his legs, holding it tightly. Ludlow SCREAMS -- -- and the rex bits down decisively. The bone breaks with dry SNAP. Ludlow HOWLS in pain, unable to move, and the b toddles forward eagerly. Ludlow can only stare as it leap up, onto his chest, and opens its jaws wide. Peter Ludlow SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow falls in a gray midwinter sky. In a cemetery, a grou fifty MOURNERS is grouped around a gravesite next to a co that is festooned with cascades of flowers. On a table, t is an array of framed photographs -- -- of JOHN HAMMOND. A MINISTER reads from the Bible while Mourners wipe away tears. IAN MALCOLM stands a respectful distance from the group, KELLY right beside him. Malcolm' face is blank, tired, his sunburn out of place with the w winter setting around him. At gravesite, a Young Woman turns, looking back over her shoulder. About sixteen, she's lovely, with long blonde and an honest, open face. She notices Malcolm, recognizes him. She nudges a Young Man next to her, about thirteen years The Young Man turns and breaks into a smile just as welco As the ceremony breaks up, they walk over to him.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Hello, Lex. Tim. LEX stands on her tiptoes and kisses Malcolm on the cheek TIM extends a hand and Malcolm shakes it. MALCOLM (cont'd) This is Kelly. My daughter. They nod their hellos.

dialogues.speaker: LEX
dialogues.text: I'm glad you came, Dr. Malcolm

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about your grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: LEX
dialogues.text: We were going to call you, in a few days. Tim and I have been thinking, and we've decided we want people to know about the island. About what we all saw.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: We think it's something our grandfather would want us to do.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (pause) Why?

dialogues.speaker: LEX
dialogues.text: Because it's true. Malcolm looks at her for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I know, Lex. But even if we're the only ones who ever know, it'll still be true. You see, I've decided that if the world found out about what your grandfather created, it wouldn't be around for very long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- it was real. You can't let people go on saying it's not.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: That's the thing about reality. He looks down at Kelly. MALCOLM (cont'd) Even when people stop believing in it, it doesn't go away. Kelly smiles and takes his hand, her slender fingers interlocking with his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back on Isla Sorna, we float over the deserted worker vil moving lightly, as in a dream.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Do you feel the cold wind blowing on your face? That's real. We sweep low, landing on the roof the helicopter took off from, the nest below now careful rebuilt with straw and scrap, a dozen unblemished eggs in the middle of it.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Do you see the four of us, standing here together, alive? That's real. A PTERANODON land gently on the nest. Ever so carefully, positions itself over the eggs, lowers itself to roosting position, and folds its giant wings around its body.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And maybe that's still that matters. The animal raises its head, opens its beak, and SQUAWKS approvingly up at the heavens.
